page.title: 19THE WILD FLOWERS OF MILTON.
page.content: In our study of the ecology of our area,we noted the wild flowers growing on the path beside the River Leven,in August,April and June.In{August,}we saw rosebay willowherbs,some already with parachute seeds,also pretty pink mallows,herb roberts and prickly thistles.{April}brought many flowers including blue periwinkles on a wall, yellow primroses in the woods,green saxifrages and yellow celandines. We found a few white anenomes.In{June} marsh marigolds or kingcups grew up the riverbanks.A small area of blue bugles was lovely.Big patches of ransoms or wild garlic had a powerful smell.Wild hyacinths or English bluebells grew under the trees.We made a list of 52 wild flowers.There were also 15 species of trees,but many were being felled.Would the flowers survive we wondered?
